Name: Tidyverse for archaeologists
Author: Ben Marwick
Topic: introduction to the tidyverse of R
Description: Slide deck with an introduction to the tidyverse, example code and tasks.
Tags: tidyverse, data import, data wrangling, visualisation, programming

Name: Skriptsammlung Statistik für die Archäologie
Author: Sophie Schmidt
Topic: basic R introduction, plotting, statistical tests
Description: Scripts in md format including code and example tasks.
Tags: data import, data wrangling, statistical tests, visualisation
Tags_openarchaeo: Educational resources and practical guides, Data management

Name: The Open Digital Archaeology Textbook
Author: Shawn Graham, Neha Gupta, Jolene Smith, Andreas Angourakis, Andrew Reinhard, Kate Ellenberger, Zack Batist, Joel Rivard, Ben Marwick, Michael Carter, Beth Compton, Rob Blades, Cristina Wood, Gary Nobles
Topic: introduction to various digital archaeology practices, including project management, database management, data cleaning, visualization, photogrammetry, 3D printing, NLP, among other things
Tools: Open Refine, GitHub, Meshlab, Excel, Jupyter
Description: An overview of various tools, methods and workflows commonly applied in digital archaeology, including practical examples demonstrated through well-documented jupyter notebooks.
Tags: data management, 3D methods, visualisation, spatial statistics, data wrangling, LOD

Name: 3DHOP integration
Author: Thomas Huet
Topic: Web3d
Description: A multi-paradigm approach (cartography, web3D, etc.) and multi-scalar presentation (macro, meso, micro) of portable tools and ancient iconography with open-source softwares (GitHub, 3DHOP, Blender, R, JavaScript, etc.) for data management within the frame of Linked-Open data (LOD).
Tags_openarchaeo: Educational resources and practical guides, 3D modelling,

Name: Developing R Packages
Author: Sophie Schmidt, Petr Pajdla, Clemens Schmid
Topic: R package development
Description: Slides and exercises introducing R package development for participants with some scripting experience.

Name: Rchaeology.eu
Author: Georg Roth
Topic: statistical analysis
Description: A collection of blog posts about various quantitative data analysis applications relevant for archaeology.

Name: LaTeX for thesis writing
Author: Sarah Lang
Topic: latex, writing
Description: Overview of Latex's capabilities that support thesis writing.

Name: LaTeX for Archaeologists: An archaeological catalogue using LaTeX
Author: Sarah Lang

Name: Quick guide to scholarly writing in Markdown with Atom
Author: Ben Marwick

Name: Learning to program: Debugging – Where to start?
Author: Sarah Lang
Topic: debugging software
Description: Guide to finding and solving errors in the code.

Name: How to maintain Twitter with little effort as an academic
Author: Sarah Lang
Topic: twitter, academic communications
Description: Guide for effective professional and institutional use of twitter

Name: Digitizing journal articles and grey literature reports
Author: ADS
Topic: digital curation, archiving and preservation
Description: Explains how to digitise journal articles or grey literature reports with a view to their long term sustainability

Name: Guides to Good Practice
Author: ADS
Topic: digital curation, archiving and preservation
Description: Series of guides to various digital curation and preservation practices
Tags: writing, archiving, project management, data management, archiving

Name: CIDOC-CRM Game
Author: George Bruseker, Anais Guillem
Topic: CIDOC CRM
Description: A fun way to visualize and play with the ontology in relation to real world documentation scenarios. Available as both a physical tabletop card game, and in a rich virtual format too.

Author: Clemens Schmid, Martin Hinz
Topic: radiocarbon data
Description: Instructional resources for processing radiocarbon data

Name: Analyse und Visualisierung archäologischer Daten mit R

Description: Instructional resources for data visualization

Name: Mosaic Summer School 2016
Author: Franziska Faupel, Daniel Knitter
Topic: spatial statistics

Name: Statistical Methods for Archaeological Data Analysis (Hinz)
Author: Martin Hinz
Topic: basic statistics
Description: Course, intro into R, Descriptive stats, NHST, Explorative statistics.

Name: Predictive Mapping in R
Author: Martin Hinz
Topic: predictive mapping
Description: Tutorial Workshop given at the International Colloquium on Digital Archaeology in Bern.

Name: Video tutorials about R for archaeologists
Author: Martin Hinz
Topic: basic statistics
Description: Collected works from different courses.
Tags: basic statistics, data import, data wrangling, visualisation

Name: How To Do Archaeological Science Using R
Author: Ben Marwick
Topic: statistical analysis, agent-based modelling, radiocarbon analysis, geospatial analysis
Description: This website is a early draft of an edited volume of contributions to the ‘How To Do Archaeological Science Using R’ forum.
Tags: spatial statistics, ABM, C14, Bayes, R as GIS, predictive modelling

Name: Tutorial on Classification in Archaeology: Distance Matrices, Clustering Methods and Validation
Author: Sophie Schmidt, Sarah Martini, Robert Staniuk, Carole Quatrelive, Martin Hinz, Oliver Nakoinz, Michael Bilger, Romy Plath, Georg Roth, Julian Laabs
Topic: classification and clustering methods
Description: The tutorial offers an introduction into classification in general, distance measures for data on all levels of measurement, hierarchical clustering with different linking methods, k-means clustering, hdbscan clustering and the silhouette validation method. All examples are developed using real life archaeological data from the archdata package. The tutorial aims at archaeologists  familiar with the scripting language R, but can be also gainfully read by those who wish to apply the methods in another software.
Tags: clustering, data import, data wrangling, multivariate statistics
Citation: Schmidt, Sophie C., Martini, Sarah, Staniuk, Robert, Quatrelivre, Carole, Hinz, Martin, Nakoinz, Oliver, Bilger, Michael, Roth, Georg, & Laabs, Julian. (2022, March 3). Tutorial on Classification in Archaeology: Distance Matrices, Clustering Methods and Validation. Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.6325372

Name: Computational Population Genetics
Author: Stephan Schiffels
Topic: basic population genetic analysis
Description: This repository contains several Jupyter Notebooks that I have used in the past for teaching various elements of population-genetic data analyses to students with no initial training in population genetics or Unix-based data analysis.

Name: 2019 Workshop on Computational Population Genetics
Author: Stephan Schiffels, Choongwon Jeong, Benjamin Peter
Topic: basic and more advanced population genetics and archaeogenetics
Description: An introduction to some of the most important archaeogenetic data/software/methods at the time

Name: A Step-by-Step Guide for Using Agent-Based Modeling in Archaeological Research
Author: Iza Romanowska, Stefani Crabtree, Kathryn Harris, Benjamin Davies
Topic: introduction to agent-based modeling with tutorials published as a special section in Advances in Archaeological Practice
Description: Tutorials on how to build simple agent-based models for archaeology published as a special section in Advances in Archaeological Practice. Link leads to open preprint.
Citation: Advances in Archaeological Practice , Volume 7 , Issue 2 , May 2019 , pp. 178 – 184. DOI: https://doi.org/10.1017/aap.2019.6

Name: Agent-Based Modeling for Archaeology – Simulating the Complexity of Societies
Author: Iza Romanowska, Colin Wren, Stefani Crabtree
Topic: introductory textbook on agent-based modeling
Description: open-access textbook for agent-based modeling in archaeology with lots of tutorials and code examples

Name: Analyzing archaeological data in R (stat4arch)
Author: Petr Pajdla, Peter Tkáč
Topic: slides, syllabus etc. for an uni course on introductory R in archaeology
Description: Slides and syllabus for a uni course on R and more. Aiminng at promoting good practice regarding data management and reproducible workflows among the students.

Name: CRAN Task View: Archaeological Science
Author: Ben Marwick
Topic: comprehensive list of R packages used in archaeology and list of articles, preferably with code and data included
Description: Includes list of R packages, articles and short introductory how-to guide for beginners.

Name: Data organization in spreadsheets
Author: Karl Broman
Topic: guide on how to organize your data in spreadsheets
Description: Guide with very basic information on how to organize data.

Name: PyQGIS 101
Author: Anita Graser
Topic: PyQGIS introduction
Description: This tutorial aims to help GIS users to get started with Python programming for QGIS 3. In contrast to many tutorials out there, the idea is to not assume any previous programming knowledge.

Name: Cow-culating your data with spreadsheets and R
Author: Paulina F. Przystupa, L. Meghan Dennis
Topic: basic data visualization using spreadsheets and R, how to explore bias in data, and creative ways to present data
Description: Tutorial about fundamental data processing and analysis practices
Tags: data literacy, data stories, open data, public engagement, teaching
Citation: Przystupa, Paulina F. and L. Meghan Dennis 2022 Cow-culating your data with spreadsheets and R. The Alexandria Archive Institute. DOI: https://doi.org/10.6078/M73N21HR

Name: Gabbing about Gabii: Going from Notes to Data to Narrative
Author: L. Meghan Dennis, Paulina F. Przystupa
Topic: turning site forms into usable and filterable tables; how to turn those data into narratives using different narrative lenses
Description: Tutorial about digitizing and processing data from paper records
Tags: data literacy, data stories, digital collections, narrative, open data, teaching
Citation: Dennis, L. Meghan and Paulina F. Przystupa 2022 Gabbing about Gabii: Going from Notes to Data to Narrative. The Alexandria Archive Institute. DOI: https://doi.org/10.6078/M7B27SF5

Name: RGBCatastrophe: A Netlogo tool for teaching, learning, and thinking about complexity
Author: Andre Costopoulos
Description: Helps students understand the basic insight that a single kind of cause can have a broad range of impacts, depending on the context in which it happens, and the related insight that simple interactions between a few elements can generate complex and unpredictable behaviour. It can help us understand how system state relates to consequences and how rapid and sudden change can take place.

Name: Introduction to R and the Tidyverse
Author: Clemens Schmid
Topic: data analysis with R and the tidyverse
Description: A book chapter to follow along and learn about basic data analysis with R and the tidyverse.
Tags: tidyverse, data import, data wrangling, visualisation, programming

Name: GIS in Archaeology
Author: Joe Roe
Topic: introduction to use of Geographic Information Systems (GIS) software in archaeology, including basic skills in cartography, geospatial data management, and spatial analysis.
Description: Online textbook for a course taught at the University of Bern. The course is designed to be delivered in in-person labs, but can probably be worked through independently as well.

Name: Statistical Methods for Archaeological Data Analysis (Roe)
Author: Joe Roe
Topic: introduction to statistical analysis in archaeology using R.
Description: Online textbook for a course taught at the University of Bern. The course is designed to be delivered in in-person labs, but can probably be worked through independently as well.
Tags: basic statistics, exploratory data analysis, tidyverse, data wrangling, visualisation, programming

Name: Online Companion to Network Science in Archaeology
Author: Matthew A. Peeples, Tom Brughmans
Topic: a series of tutorials that outline methods for managing, analyzing, and visualizing network data, primarily using the R programming language
Description: The tutorials are designed to complement the text of the associated book (Brughmans and Peeples 2023) but can also stand alone as a guide to implementation of network analyses in R if you have a basic background in network methods and terminology. Although each section of this guide builds upon the previous sections in terms of network concepts and R methods, the sections are each independent in terms of data, examples, and code and can be run out of order if you choose.
Tags: data wrangling, network analysis, multivariate statistics, spatial statistics
Citation: Peeples, Matthew A. and Tom Brughmans (2023). Online Companion to Network Science in Archaeology. https://archnetworks.net, Accessed 2023-03-21.

Name: Introduction to Ancient Metagenomics
Author: James A. Fellows Yates, Christina Warinner, Alina Hiß, Arthur Kocher, Clemens Schmid, Irina Velsko, Maxime Borry, Megan Michel, Nikolay Oskolkov, Sebastian Duchene, Thiseas Lamnidis, Aida Andrades Valtueña, Alexander Herbig, Alexander Hübner, Kevin Nota, Robin Warner, Meriam Guellil
Topic: introduction to various computational analysis in the field of ancient metagenomics
Description: This book introduces the main steps of ancient metagenomic bioinformatic workflows, familiarising students with the command line, demonstrating how to process next-generation-sequencing (NGS) data, and showing how to perform de novo metagenomic assembly.
Citation: James A. Fellows Yates, Christina Warinner, Alina Hiß, Arthur Kocher, Clemens Schmid, Irina Velsko, Maxime Borry, Megan Michel, Nikolay Oskolkov, Sebastian Duchene, Thiseas Lamnidis, Aida Andrades Valtueña, Alexander Herbig, Alexander Hübner, Kevin Nota, Robin Warner, Meriam Guellil. (2023). Introduction to Ancient Metagenomics (Edition 2023). Zenodo. DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.8027281

Description: A book chapter explaining how to navigate, run commands and program in the bash shell.
